column1: 4104740820,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-intelligence-data-analyst-at-scalapay-4104740820?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=wBI%2FKKnYWz%2FgpEHCLyZC7A%3D%3D&trackingId=PL1IvD7gKZku0Je2pARtDg%3D%3D,Business Intelligence Data Analyst,Scalapay,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Thanks to our innovative BuyNow PayLater payment solution, Scalapay is transforming the way more than 6.5 million customers buy online and in-store, empowering 8,000+ merchants (online and in-store) to give their customers magical shopping experiences.

Being only 3 years old didnâ€™t stop us from becoming a unicorn ðŸ¦„ We have raised over $700mln and we did this thanks to a team built around our 4 core values: #MakeItHappen #PlayAsATeam #StayCurious #FocusOnCustomer.
This is where your magic happens. If you love it, Scalapay it â™¥

Our data team seeks a Business Intelligence Data Analyst who will champion a 'data-first' mindset, ensuring precise measurement and reporting of relevant metrics. This role collaborates closely with Scalapayâ€™s key Business Units such as Product, Marketing and Sales, employing technical expertise to translate concepts into concrete outcomes.
Serve as the data point of reference for our key Business Units, providing them with necessary support
Use advanced analytical tools to assess and interpret sales and marketing data, measuring the effectiveness of activities and pinpointing areas for improvement
Build and maintain comprehensive reports and dashboards for our teams to facilitate data-driven decision-making
Translate business questions into analytical solutions, providing actionable insights
Ensure accuracy and reliability in measuring key performance indicators (KPIs) and the underlying data
Identify trends, patterns, and areas for improvement in order to propose data-driven recommendations to optimise marketing strategies and sales processes
Conduct hands-on work with data, including data cleansing, transformation, and validation
Help us extend a data-driven mindset throughout Scalapay
Be an active member of the Data team, helping to develop and enhance our suite of Business Intelligence tooling.
Youâ€™ll be great for this role if:
You have a minimum of 3 years of experience in a data-driven role, ideally with a background in startups or fintech
You have strong SQL skills, Python is a plus
You are proficient in data visualisation tools and data storytelling
You have a background in statistics and can conduct experiments or validate hypotheses
You are fluent in Italian and English: you must be totally confident talking and sharing results in English in a sharp and concise way
You demonstrate outstanding communication skills, both verbally and in writing. You excel at simplifying complex topics into straightforward solutions and ideas
Youâ€™re more than data-driven, you are obsessed with data!
Attractive packages based on skills and experience - the salary we have for this position is up to 40'000â‚¬ (Gross Annual Base)
International environment with significant challenges to be met every day
Lots of opportunities to work with a team of industry tech leaders who are focused on delivering products that offer exceptional user experiences
Personalised support to accelerate your professional growth and take ownership of the products you deliver: we want to help you grow!
Latest technologies and being encouraged to bring your flair to the role.
Initial Chat: A brief conversation with our Talent Acquisition team
Hiring Manager Interview: A deep dive into your experience and motivation for the role
Case Study: A skills-based test with a debriefing session involving key stakeholders, conducted in our Milan office
Final Chat with Simone (CEO): An opportunity to discuss Scalapayâ€™s values and assess cultural alignment.
Want to learn more? Don't hesitate to explore our Careers website, our LinkedIn and Glassdoor pages.
Pro tip: send your CV in English ðŸ˜‰
Super Pro tip: we know that application processes can be scary and frustrating butâ€¦ we look for talent, not people that tick all our boxes.
We believe in the power of diversity: Scalapay is an Equal Opportunity Employer for any minority, disability, gender identity or sexual orientation.

4130498632,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-at-subito-4130498632?position=2&pageNum=0&refId=wBI%2FKKnYWz%2FgpEHCLyZC7A%3D%3D&trackingId=9PlXezLJ6e4MWgdyNRjrng%3D%3D,Data Analyst,Subito,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Weâ€™re Adevinta, a global leader in digital marketplaces. Our household name brands, including Marktplaats in the Netherlands, mobile.de in Germany and leboncoin in France, reach hundreds of millions of people every month.

Weâ€™re all about matchmaking, and our sites help people find whatever theyâ€™re looking for in their local communities â€“ whether itâ€™s a car, an apartment, a sofa or a new job. Every connection made or item found makes a difference by creating a world where people share more and waste less.

Our brands are supported by global Tech Hubs in Barcelona, Amsterdam, Paris and Berlin. Their goal is to develop common global products and innovation platforms which all of our brands can use. This means using cutting edge technology to create highly scalable, customisable and secure products and components that free up development time and leverage our access to global data.
What Youâ€™ll Do & Who You Are
We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subitoâ€™s team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.
The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.
The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so itâ€™s more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding
4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences
Prior experience in a digital company
Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
Hands on experience on Data Science projects
Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
â€˜Work from anywhereâ€™ weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a â‚¬8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you donâ€™t meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they donâ€™t meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

column2:
Who You Are

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join Subitoâ€™s team. Our mission is to turn data into insights, and get a clear understanding of the Italian market and marketplace industry.

The Data Analyst will be part of the Business Analytics team mainly supporting the Management Team, Finance, Marketing and Sales departments in the decision making process.

The Data Analyst will study user behaviour, evaluate strategic initiatives and new features. Above all, your work will impact the growth of our business.

Your Typical Day

  • Mash up and analyse different data sets to support the business with high-value insights (we have some data engineering heroes, so itâ€™s more analysing than mashing up!) and structure presentations showing the findings to a variety of stakeholders
  • Formulate/test hypotheses to explain underlying reasons about business dynamics
  • Design clear, automated reports to democratise data access to the whole company
  • Work in a cross functional team, mostly focusing on the business insights generation in collaboration with colleagues of Marketing, Finance and Sales departments
  • Contribute both on short term analysis and long term initiatives, either local or global
  • Dig deep in our data lake and build Machine Learning models to make Subito a smarter product and enhance business understanding

Skills Required

  • 4+ years of experience as Data Analyst / Data Scientist
  • Highly proficient with SQL
  • Knowledge of one or more analytics languages, ideally Python
  • Applied knowledge of statistical techniques
  • Data visualization and presentation skills to match a wide range of audiences

Plus

  • Good English proficiency level
  • Prior experience in a digital company
  • Experience with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure, GCP...)
  • Hands on experience on Data Science projects

Benefits

  • Competitive compensation package
  • Opportunity to shape the way we work. Your feedback and opinions are valued at all levels of the organisation
  • Benefits including stock purchase plan and annual bonus plans
  • Flexibility to work when and how you want - flexible hours, autonomy to set your own agenda, choice of phone and computer
  • Smart Working Policy - work remotely some of the time, balanced with time in the office together with your team - between 5 and 45 days per quarter in the office depending on each team.
  • â€˜Work from anywhereâ€™ weeks - up to four weeks working from anywhere, as long as you have an internet connection!
  • Career development, including language classes and Adevinta Academies: specialised content built by our experts on Machine Learning, Agile, Leadership and more

For each working day, you will be eligible for a â‚¬8 meal voucher., You can use our local provider Fitprime to maintain physical well-being., You will receive 250 euros on the welfare platform after the birth of your child

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

If you feel like you donâ€™t meet all of the requirements for this role but are interested, please consider applying anyway. Research suggests that women and individuals from underrepresented groups may self-select out of opportunities if they donâ€™t meet 100% of the job requirements. We strongly encourage people from historically excluded groups to apply and look forward to speaking with you.

Lavorerai nella nostra sede di Milano in spazi di nuova generazione e potrai operare anche da casa e ovunque grazie alle nuove politiche di smart working. Lo stage Ã¨ retribuito (sono previsti anche i buoni pasto) e ha una durata di 6 mesi con possibilitÃ  di proroga o eventuale assunzione.
Ok, ma cosa farai di preciso?

verificare e pianificare le coperture dei punti vendita da parte dei merchandiser
analizzare i dati di vendita e di tanti altri parametri
valutare i dati tramite indicatori chiave di performance (KPI)
preparare presentazioni in PowerPoint di riepilogo dei report realizzati.
Non sarai solo ma sempre supportato da figure esperte che sapranno trasmetterti le loro competenze e i loro segreti.
Per fare uno stage in CPM come Data Analyst puÃ² essere utile un percorso di studi di economia o in ambito IT, ma lâ€™unico vero must Ã¨ la voglia di imparare e mettersi in gioco.
hai la passione per i numeri
te la cavi con excel e altri programmi informatici
Ricerchiamo una persona che s'identifichi con i valori CPM: condivisione e propensione al lavoro di team, curiositÃ , integrazione, lavorare per obiettivi sia individuali che di gruppo.

Ai sensi della legge 12 Marzo 1999, n.68 Inventa CPM promuove l'inserimento e l'integrazione delle persone disabili nel mondo del lavoro, per questo motivo verranno tenute in particolare considerazione le candidature di tutti i soggetti indicati al comma 1 art.1 della succitata legge.

4148274143,https://be.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-analyst-power-bi-at-laco-4148274143?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=JnkgKRoo5ft8iVIZ%2BIFFoA%3D%3D&trackingId=ozopHoQeVgvu4%2F2QU4KXmQ%3D%3D,Data Analyst / Power BI,LACO,"Brussels, Brussels Region, Belgium","We are searching for a Data Analyst / Power BI to strengthen our Microsoft-Team! To join them in working on new upcoming projects.

LACO is a Belgian-based business intelligence and data analytics company that exist for more than 35 years now. We are a Microsoft Data & AI Solutions Partner with extensive expertise in various areas, including Microsoft BI and Data Governance. With over 120 consultants, we are dedicated to helping businesses succeed with data. We blend dedication with a dash of fun in everything we do.

At LACO, we value long-term relationships with both our clients and colleagues. We have recently secured several large projects with key clients, and to support these, we are looking to strengthen our Microsoft team to deliver end-to-end projects alongside the LACO team.
As a Data Analyst/Power BI Expert at LACO, youâ€™ll be responsible for:
Understanding and mapping out the requirements of the business.
Collecting, cleaning and pre-processing data from various sources.
Working closely with cross-functional teams and leveraging your expertise in Power BI to create compelling visualizations and reports.
Designing, optimizing, and developing Power BI reports and dashboards to meet business needs and requirements.
Working closely with stakeholders to gather and understand data requirements, ensuring data accuracy and consistency.
Troubleshooting and resolving issues with Power BI reports, transforming complex data sets into meaningful insights through the creation of data visualizations.
Staying up to date with the latest Power BI Microsoft Fabric features and best practices to excel in this role.
You have a Bachelorâ€™s and/or Masterâ€™s degree in computer science or equivalent.
You have at least 3 years proven experience as a Power BI Developer or a similar role.
You know all about the programming languages SQL, DAX and Python.
You can model data using Kimball, Dimensional Modelling and Data Vault.
You are proficient in Power BI, including DAX, data modelling and custom visuals.
You get even more bonus points if â€¦
You have a good knowledge of Azure Synapse, Data Factory, and Databricks.
You are familiar with diverse types of data storage for structured data.
You are a strong communicator with teamwork abilities.
You are fluent in Dutch and/or French and English.
Weâ€™re open to work with Employees and Freelancers
Receive an attractive salary package, along with excellent benefits.
Training opportunities to enhance your knowledge and advance your career in your chosen field.
Be involved in innovative Microsoft tracks that challenge and inspire you.
A great company culture with room for fun events such as: family day, yearly ski trip, sports events, game nights, â€¦
Donâ€™t let this opportunity slip through your data fingers! Get in touch with our Talent Acquisition team and embark on your adventure to success.

We are searching for a Data Analyst / Power BI to strengthen our Microsoft-Team! To join them in working on new upcoming projects.

We are looking for a skilled and enthusiastic Data Analyst to join our dynamic and solution-oriented team. In this role, you will be the crucial link between the business and operational services, supporting key departments such as sales, claims, underwriting, and product development. Variety will be your daily reality, with opportunities to contribute across diverse areas like implementing AI solutions, supporting pricing strategies, and providing actionable insights.


What Will You Do?

You will:

  • Support the business by answering complex quantitative questions and delivering clear, actionable insights.
  • Monitor and analyze product portfolios to identify trends and improvement opportunities.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to support product development and pricing exercises.
  • Provide data-driven recommendations to enhance performance across departments.
  • Coach and train colleagues to strengthen their analytical capabilities.


Your Strengths

Weâ€™re looking for someone who:

  • Is fluent in English and has a strong knowledge of Dutch or French, with a good understanding of the other language.
  • Knowledge of Qlik or similar data visualization tools.
  • Has advanced expertise in Microsoft Excel, with little left to learn in the tool.
  • Holds a degree in fields like Business Administration, Business Economics, Business Engineering, or an equivalent qualification through experience.
  • Has a passion for numbers and the ability to explain complex analyses to non-experts.
  • Tackles challenges proactively and learns from every experience.
  • Combines pragmatism, openness to feedback, and a critical yet positive mindset.
  • Can work independently but thrives in a team-oriented, self-steered environment.


Nice-to-Haves

  • Experience in insurance.
  • An interest in AI, machine learning, or advanced analytics techniques.


What We Offer

  • A varied and dynamic role within a supportive team.
  • A modern workspace with flexible working arrangements, including remote work options.
  • A full-time, permanent contract with competitive compensation and fringe benefits.
  • Additional vacation days to maintain a healthy work-life balance.
  • Opportunities for continuous learning and personal development.


If youâ€™re ready to take initiative, contribute to impactful projects, and join a team that values collaboration and innovation, weâ€™re eager to meet you. Apply now and be part of a company where your well-being and professional growth are top priorities.

The candidate will analyse and interpret large volumes of data and evaluate results to provide insights that assist decision-making.
During system implementation projects, they conduct source-to-target data mapping activities by thoroughly examining entities, products, and processes to ensure coherent mapping.
We are looking for experience in SQL for data manipulation, strong technical and analytical skills, and programming knowledge (Python/R).
You must demonstrate clear and capable communication and presentation skills as a consultant.
BSc or an MSc in a relevant topic such as Maths, Computer Science or Statistics, etc..

Our consulting client is looking for a Data Analyst to join the team in Brussels.


Experience in the Insurance industry is mandatory.


The candidate will analyse and interpret large volumes of data and evaluate results to provide insights that assist decision-making.


During system implementation projects, they conduct source-to-target data mapping activities by thoroughly examining entities, products, and processes to ensure coherent mapping.


Responsibilities:


  • Data Collection and Processing
  • Data Analysis
  • Data Visualization
  • Reporting and Presentation
  • Data-Driven Decision Making
  • Continuous Improvement and Learning


Your Skills:


  • We are looking for experience in SQL for data manipulation, strong technical and analytical skills, and programming knowledge (Python/R).
  • You must demonstrate clear and capable communication and presentation skills as a consultant.
  • Tableau/Power BI, matplotlib
  • BSc or an MSc in a relevant topic such as Maths, Computer Science or Statistics, etc..

Student in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or related field

Job Profile

4133404356,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/business-reporting-analyst-at-ralph-lauren-4133404356?position=6&pageNum=0&refId=ShjfMc%2B3nS1gmB3iVXNzOg%3D%3D&trackingId=ks3sFezMthbj1pEI005BLQ%3D%3D,Business & Reporting Analyst,Ralph Lauren,"Plan-les-Ouates, Geneva, Switzerland","Ralph Lauren Corporation (NYSE:RL) is a global leader in the design, marketing and distribution of premium lifestyle products in five categories: apparel, accessories, home, fragrances, and hospitality. For more than 50 years, Ralph Lauren's reputation and distinctive image have been consistently developed across an expanding number of products, brands and international markets. The Company's brand names, which include Ralph Lauren, Ralph Lauren Collection, Ralph Lauren Purple Label, Polo Ralph Lauren, Double RL, Lauren Ralph Lauren, Polo Ralph Lauren Children, Chaps, among others, constitute one of the world's most widely recognized families of consumer brands.

At Ralph Lauren, we unite and inspire the communities within our company as well as those in which we serve by amplifying voices and perspectives to create a culture of belonging, ensuring inclusion, and fairness for all. We foster a culture of inclusion through: Talent, Education & Communication, Employee Groups and Celebration.
Provide cross functional analysis and design powerful visualizations to support our stakeholders in making strategic decisions.
Develop standards and tools to enhance automation of reports and connections to/from them.
Design, Create, Implement, And Maintain Reporting And Tools By
Coordinating with other data analyst/data scientist/IT teams to lead common projects and drive best practice solutions that are aligned company wide
Collecting, monitoring, and analyzing data to identify areas of improvements, risks, and business changes
Maintaining databases and tools, and performing updates as necessary to ensure accuracy
Developing new tools to continuously improve process efficiency and integrate new business requirements
Collecting cross-functional analysis & reporting needs, department tools and opportunities for standardization and automation of processes.
Designing, producing, enhancing reports, dashboards and tools for the Integrated Business Planning function including Inventory Management
Helping to drive critical business decisions by analyzing metrics and designing reports
Providing suggestions based on findings that might be utilized to inform business strategies
Providing an on-going presence â€˜on the groundâ€™ to help end users leverage the tools and available training
Being the first â€œline of supportâ€ when an issue arises
Education level: Bachelorâ€™s degree or higher in Business, Computer Science, Information Systems, Math, Statistics, or a related discipline
Strong technical and analytical skills. Aptitude for problem solving and for turning data inputs into relevant information
High degree of computer literacy, especially MS Excel and VBA
Strong SQL and SAP BI skills are highly desirable
Power Query, DataIku, MS Azure, MS Access, Python would be a strong plus
What Is Required For This Position
Efficient time management, priority setting, and capacity to meet deadlines
Attention to detail and accuracy, curiosity, and a mindset of continuous learning and improvement
Passionate team player with ability to take ownership and accountability for tasks
Fluent in reading, speaking, and writing in English, with French a strong plus

4129607911,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/international-client-data-analyst-intern-at-cartier-4129607911?position=7&pageNum=0&refId=ShjfMc%2B3nS1gmB3iVXNzOg%3D%3D&trackingId=0BY5mCNph9HcRmIrHGYLjQ%3D%3D,International Client Data Analyst Intern,Cartier,"Meyrin, Geneva, Switzerland","Join the Client Marketing Data Knowledge
This position is embedded within the dynamic Client Marketing team, which is based on four key pillars: Client Relations, Client Services, Client Insights, and Client Marketing Data & Knowledge.

As an International Client Data Analyst Intern, you'll be part of the Client Marketing Data & Knowledge team, reporting to the International Senior Client Data Analyst. This internship offers a unique opportunity to contribute to the Maison's Client Knowledge strategy.

You'll play a key role in updating and enriching our annual Client Profiling analysis, providing markets with detailed KPIs on their clients' behavior. This analysis is crucial for understanding client preferences, trends, and opportunities for growth.
HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?
Update and enrich our annual Client Profiling analysis
Elevate Client Knowledge: Be part of the refinement and development of our annual Client Profiling analysis.
Data Visualization Expertise: Master tools like Power BI or Looker to craft insightful dashboards.
QA Tester: Conduct tests to ensure the accuracy, completeness and consistency of Client Profiling data.
Streamline Deployment: Manage project deliveries with meticulous planning, follow-up, and coordination, ensuring smooth execution.
Leverage this Client Profiling analysis and support Client Community
Bridging the Gap: Facilitate the seamless integration of the Client Profiling analysis with our Looker Clients Analytics platform, creating a unified view of client insights.
Answering Business Questions: conduct ad-hoc client studies to address specific business needs and provide actionable insights.
Knowledge Sharing: Train and support users on the reports, empowering them to extract valuable insights and leverage the data effectively.
HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

Academic Background: You are a Master student looking for an end-of-study internship in Computer Sciences, Computer Engineering or from a generalist Engineering/Business school with a specialization in data.
Analytical Mindset: You possess a strong analytical mindset, problem-solving skills, and a creative approach to data analysis.
Technical Proficiency: You have proven experience with SQL and ideally some knowledge of a data visualization tool (Tableau, Looker, Power BI are highly valued).
Organizational Skills: You are organized, detail-oriented, and adept at prioritizing tasks effectively.
Communication & Collaboration: You excel at communication, collaboration, and organization, with the ability to interact effectively with diverse teams.
Language Fluency: You are fluent in both French and English, both written and spoken.
Office Suite Proficiency: You are comfortable working with the Microsoft Office suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Teams, etc.).

    FÃ¼r Fragen steht Dir Sabrina Karthe (karthe@valuequest.ch) gerne zur VerfÃ¼gung. Bitte nur Direktbewerbungen.

    Mehr Informationen zu ValueQuest findest Du unter: www.valuequest.ch


    Bewirb Dich jetzt und werde Teil des ValueQuest-Teams!

4151457184,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/product-data-analyst-internship-at-lastminute-com-4151457184?position=9&pageNum=0&refId=ShjfMc%2B3nS1gmB3iVXNzOg%3D%3D&trackingId=wHy1be5XBR%2FSYjlQkTzB3Q%3D%3D,Product Data Analyst (Internship),lastminute.com,"Chiasso, Ticino, Switzerland","At lastminute.com, we live for the holidays. We are the European Travel-Tech leader in Dynamic Holiday Packages. With technology, we turn spontaneous thoughts into meaningful experiences, helping people travel the world.

We are looking for a Product Data Analyst Intern to join our team and gain hands-on experience in data analytics. This is an exciting opportunity to develop analytical skills, work with real-world data, and contribute to improving the travelerâ€™s journey. If you are passionate about solving complex problems and eager to learn how data drives business decisions, keep on reading!

The candidate will have the opportunity to become an integral part of the team, learning how to extract and analyze data to produce actionable insights and improve customer experience. Specifically, the analyst will have the chance to support the optimization of post-sales processes and assist in cross domain projects.
Job Title - Product Data Analyst Intern
Team - you will join the Data Analytics team within the Technology department.
Assist with data extraction, analysis and reporting, in order to drive performance insights and support business decisions
Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns to optimise business performance
Works closely with internal stakeholders in order to identify and prioritise business needs and opportunities
Learn how to communicate and present results, insights and recommendations to all levels of the company, clearly and concisely
Cooperate with other Data Analysts across the company on joint projects, to identify and exploit synergies and to preserve/improve governance on data and on business knowledge
Closely partner with Data Engineers to identify data needs and support the data quality of the deliverables
- Currently pursuing or recently completed a STEM degree
- Familiarity with data visualization tools like Qlik, Tableau, Looker, Power BI.
- Interest in digital, ecommerce business and travel industry
- Experience in building pipelines and data models
- An inclusive, friendly, and international environment (youâ€™ll be working with colleagues from +10 countries and over 48 nationalities)
- Shorter working week (36h as full time), with a half working day on Fridays
- Flexible start and end of the working day
- Possibility to work from anywhere for a period of time per year defined according to local regulations
- Fri-Yays: half a day on Friday morning with a no-meeting mandate and dedicated to deep work, personal growth, learning and training and/or focus time.

- Professional and managerial skills development training paths, access to e-learning platforms such as Oâ€™reilly, Udemy, Coursera (depending on the department), and to our internal platform offering bespoke training content.
- 2 paid days off per year for volunteering purposes
- Occasional social events to foster connections among colleagues
- Travel industry discounts and flash exclusive staff fares
- We support our employees through life's significant moments with leave options (e.g. parental responsibilities, marriages, bereavements, relocations, etc.)
Wish you were here? We do, too!
(*Please note the process can slightly vary. The recruiter in charge will share more details when setting up the interview)
Our commitment to celebrate diversity and generate belonging

At the heart of our culture is a commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, sexual orientation, religion, gender identity or expression, and accessibility. We strongly believe in an equal opportunity space, which is welcoming and celebrates the uniqueness of everyone who works here. We value different lived experiences and respect viewpoints, as we know unicity drives innovation. We want to make sure our people reflect the communities across the world we help travel.

By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you are legally authorised to work in the country of employment and that you do not require visa sponsorship to obtain employment visa status.

At lastminute.com, we live for the holidays. We are the European Travel-Tech leader in Dynamic Holiday Packages. With technology, we turn spontaneous thoughts into meaningful experiences, helping people travel the world.



Job Description

We are looking for a Product Data Analyst Intern to join our team and gain hands-on experience in data analytics. This is an exciting opportunity to develop analytical skills, work with real-world data, and contribute to improving the travelerâ€™s journey. If you are passionate about solving complex problems and eager to learn how data drives business decisions, keep on reading!

The candidate will have the opportunity to become an integral part of the team, learning how to extract and analyze data to produce actionable insights and improve customer experience. Specifically, the analyst will have the chance to support the optimization of post-sales processes and assist in cross domain projects.

The job in brief:

Job Title - Product Data Analyst Intern

Working model - Chiasso hybrid

Team - you will join the Data Analytics team within the Technology department.
Level - Internship

Location - Chiasso

Contract - Internship - full-time (EUR 36 h/week)

Duration: 12 months

Travel time required - No

What your impact will be

  • Assist with data extraction, analysis and reporting, in order to drive performance insights and support business decisions
  • Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns to optimise business performance
  • Works closely with internal stakeholders in order to identify and prioritise business needs and opportunities
  • Learn how to communicate and present results, insights and recommendations to all levels of the company, clearly and concisely
  • Cooperate with other Data Analysts across the company on joint projects, to identify and exploit synergies and to preserve/improve governance on data and on business knowledge
  • Closely partner with Data Engineers to identify data needs and support the data quality of the deliverables

Qualifications

Your expertise:

- Currently pursuing or recently completed a STEM degree

- Knowledge of SQL and Excel.

- Familiarity with data visualization tools like Qlik, Tableau, Looker, Power BI.

- Proficiency in English.

Desirable:

- Python

- Interest in digital, ecommerce business and travel industry

- Experience in building pipelines and data models



Additional Information

How we work together:

- An inclusive, friendly, and international environment (youâ€™ll be working with colleagues from +10 countries and over 48 nationalities)

- Shorter working week (36h as full time), with a half working day on Fridays
- Flexible start and end of the working day
- Possibility to work from anywhere for a period of time per year defined according to local regulations

How we learn together:

- Fri-Yays: half a day on Friday morning with a no-meeting mandate and dedicated to deep work, personal growth, learning and training and/or focus time.

- Professional and managerial skills development training paths, access to e-learning platforms such as Oâ€™reilly, Udemy, Coursera (depending on the department), and to our internal platform offering bespoke training content.

Other perks:
- 2 paid days off per year for volunteering purposes

- Occasional social events to foster connections among colleagues

- Travel industry discounts and flash exclusive staff fares

- We support our employees through life's significant moments with leave options (e.g. parental responsibilities, marriages, bereavements, relocations, etc.)

Wish you were here? We do, too!

Selection process steps*:

- HR interview (10-30 minutes)

- Offline Tech test

- 1st interview (Manager): Test review

- 2nd interview (Manager + team member):

- Offer extended
(*Please note the process can slightly vary. The recruiter in charge will share more details when setting up the interview)

Our commitment to celebrate diversity and generate belonging

At the heart of our culture is a commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, sexual orientation, religion, gender identity or expression, and accessibility. We strongly believe in an equal opportunity space, which is welcoming and celebrates the uniqueness of everyone who works here. We value different lived experiences and respect viewpoints, as we know unicity drives innovation. We want to make sure our people reflect the communities across the world we help travel.

Eligibility criteria:
By submitting your information and application, you confirm that you are legally authorised to work in the country of employment and that you do not require visa sponsorship to obtain employment visa status.

In the context of the Luxury New Retail, Richemont Group is accelerating its logistics transformation reshaping our logistics network across all Regions.
Agility, Flexibility, Speed and Customer-centricity are the key drivers for a successful logistics transformation across our Maisons.

By joining our Group Logistics Business Performance team, you will contribute to the development, standardization, and optimization of our end-to-end logistics reporting and performance KPIs across all regions.
HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

As a Logistics Data Analyst intern, you will play a key role in modernizing our data analytics ecosystem. You will support the migration of logistics databases to our new data lake in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) BigQuery and help transition all Power BI dashboards to Looker, ensuring seamless data visualization and reporting.
Assist in migrating of logistics databases to the new data lake in GCP BigQuery.
Rebuild and optimize Power BI dashboards in Looker, ensuring accuracy and performance.
Process, clean, and validate data integrity for analytics.
Collaborate with logistics teams to identify and resolve data discrepancies in dashboards.
Document standard logistics performance metrics and best practices for reporting.
Participate in cross-functional logistics projects, contributing to data-driven decision-making.
HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

You are a student or recent graduate in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field. You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an interest in data visualization and business intelligence.
You have experience in data processing, cleaning and validation to ensure data integrity.
You are autonomous, organized, with a proactive mindset to drive improvements and the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders.
You speak English fluently (French is a plus).
You are proficient in SQL and familiar with Power BI, Looker. Experience with Python and knowledge of GCP BigQuery is a plus.
HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?
This is a unique opportunity to gain deep insights into luxury logistics operations and luxury markets.
Exposure to cutting-edge BI technologies in a dynamic, international work environment
Hands-on experience in cloud data management, business intelligence, and cross-functional logistics teams collaboration.

CONTEXT

In the context of the Luxury New Retail, Richemont Group is accelerating its logistics transformation reshaping our logistics network across all Regions.

Agility, Flexibility, Speed and Customer-centricity are the key drivers for a successful logistics transformation across our Maisons.

By joining our Group Logistics Business Performance team, you will contribute to the development, standardization, and optimization of our end-to-end logistics reporting and performance KPIs across all regions.

HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT?

As a Logistics Data Analyst intern, you will play a key role in modernizing our data analytics ecosystem. You will support the migration of logistics databases to our new data lake in Google Cloud Platform (GCP) BigQuery and help transition all Power BI dashboards to Looker, ensuring seamless data visualization and reporting.

Key Responsibilities

  • Assist in migrating of logistics databases to the new data lake in GCP BigQuery.
  • Rebuild and optimize Power BI dashboards in Looker, ensuring accuracy and performance.
  • Process, clean, and validate data integrity for analytics.
  • Collaborate with logistics teams to identify and resolve data discrepancies in dashboards.
  • Document standard logistics performance metrics and best practices for reporting.
  • Participate in cross-functional logistics projects, contributing to data-driven decision-making.

HOW WILL YOU EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US?

You are a student or recent graduate in Data Science, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field. You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an interest in data visualization and business intelligence.

You have experience in data processing, cleaning and validation to ensure data integrity.

You are autonomous, organized, with a proactive mindset to drive improvements and the ability to collaborate effectively with stakeholders.

You speak English fluently (French is a plus).

You are proficient in SQL and familiar with Power BI, Looker. Experience with Python and knowledge of GCP BigQuery is a plus.

HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING?

This is a unique opportunity to gain deep insights into luxury logistics operations and luxury markets.

Exposure to cutting-edge BI technologies in a dynamic, international work environment

Hands-on experience in cloud data management, business intelligence, and cross-functional logistics teams collaboration.

We are looking for an experienced Data Quality Analyst / Data Engineer to join a leading financial services firm in Zurich. This role will focus on ensuring high data quality standards, data profiling, and cleansing within a complex banking environment.
Role: Data Quality Analyst / Data Engineer
Start Date: End of February / Start of March
Perform data quality assessments, profiling, and cleansing
Work with SQL and Python for data manipulation and analysis
Implement and optimise data quality frameworks and processes
Collaborate with teams to improve data governance and accuracy
Work with core systems and data models, particularly in banking/financial services
Experience with data quality principles, data cleansing, and profiling tools
Understanding of data models, core banking systems, or financial data
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, IT, Data Science, or a quantitative field

column2: German is preferred

4149903218,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/intern-in-data-analysis-within-process-development-100%25-at-climeworks-4149903218?position=19&pageNum=0&refId=ShjfMc%2B3nS1gmB3iVXNzOg%3D%3D&trackingId=PqitP%2BuF9dofXJiCRT3RBA%3D%3D,Intern in Data Analysis within Process Development (100%),Climeworks,"Zurich, Zurich, Switzerland","Get to know Climeworks

Climeworks removes COâ‚‚ from the air to fight global warming and protect future generations to come. We develop, build and operate direct air capture (DAC) machines which capture COâ‚‚ directly from the air. The captured carbon dioxide is removed from the air by safely storing it underground, permanently. Founded in 2009 by engineers, Christoph Gebald and Jan Wurzbacher, Climeworks was built with a mission to inspire 1 billion people to remove COâ‚‚ from the air, and is now spearheading the DAC industry globally. It has the worldâ€™s largest DAC facility and storage installation in operation and a team of over 300 Climeworkers determined to contribute to a net-zero future. A true climate pioneer, Climeworks is featured as a TIME100 Influential Company 2022 and Global Cleantech 100 Company 2022, driving a revolutionary technology engineered to solve the most pressing issue of our time. We foster a dynamic environment and are building a global purpose driven team. We are looking for disruptive thinkers, passionate achievers and inspiring leaders that are ready to take on the worldâ€™s greatest challenge.
Your mission at Climeworks is to actively support the Process Development team in various tasks related to testing facilities, operational plants and future projects.
You will develop tools and data visualizations to support analysis of the performance of testing facilities and operational plants.
You will participate in field tests at operational plants and develop tools to aggregate the collected data and use it to improve our modelling capabilities.
You will support the definition and documentation of KPIs for testing and operational facilities.
You will contribute to setting up deviation detection and alerting systems for testing facilities and operational plants.
You have a bachelorâ€™s or masterâ€™s degree in computer science, engineering, or related fields.
You are eager to learn new concepts, skills, and tools that you might need to complete your assignments.
You are reliable, performance-driven, and maintain a structured working style.
You thrive in both fast-paced team environments and when working independently.

column2: German skills would be an advantage.

You are available for a full-time 6-month internship, ideally starting in March/April 2025.

What we offer: A horizontal organization, a great team, an improvement-oriented approach, and a scale-up venture with an innovative technology. Sounds like you? We are looking forward meeting you! Get to know Climeworks

Climeworks removes COâ‚‚ from the air to fight global warming and protect future generations to come. We develop, build and operate direct air capture (DAC) machines which capture COâ‚‚ directly from the air. The captured carbon dioxide is removed from the air by safely storing it underground, permanently. Founded in 2009 by engineers, Christoph Gebald and Jan Wurzbacher, Climeworks was built with a mission to inspire 1 billion people to remove COâ‚‚ from the air, and is now spearheading the DAC industry globally. We foster a dynamic environment and are building a global purpose driven team. We are looking for disruptive thinkers, passionate achievers and inspiring leaders that are ready to take on the worldâ€™s greatest challenge.

Will you join us?

Your Mission
Job description

Your Story

  • You thrive in both fast-paced team environments and when working independently.

While having access to state-of-the-art bioinformatics and biostatistics tools, you will gain toxicological insights from experts in the field, working in close collaboration with toxicologists and other scientists.
Ensure the accuracy, consistency, and scientific validity of toxicological data captured by large language models (LLMs)

Cross-check data outputs against original sources, evaluate the reliability of AI-derived information, and contribute to the development of high-quality datasets to support drug safety and development efforts
Review toxicological data output generated by LLMs and validate against original resources
Identify and document discrepancies, errors, or ambiguities in AI-derived data
Ensure consistency, completeness, and scientific accuracy of curated toxicological datasets
Apply toxicological knowledge to evaluate data related to preclinical and clinical toxicities, mechanisms of toxicity, safety biomarkers, and risk assessments
Provide feedback to enhance LLM performance based on identified gaps or inaccuracies in the extracted data
Masterâ€™s in Biology, Pharmacology, Toxicology, Drug Development, Biotechnology
Experience as Toxicological Data Curator with a background in Biology, Toxicology, Drug Development, or Veterinary Medicine
Experience with data curation, annotation, or systematic review methodologies
Understanding of machine learning, LLMs, or natural language processing (NLP) tools
Experienced in synthesizing complex toxicological data and in presenting conclusions
If you want to learn more about this opportunity, please feel free to reach out directly to abeassalazar@actalentservices.com
*Please note that we can only consider EU/Schengen applications, or valid Swiss permit

One of our more innovative clients is searching for a Data Specialist to act as curator for Large Language Models. While having access to state-of-the-art bioinformatics and biostatistics tools, you will gain toxicological insights from experts in the field, working in close collaboration with toxicologists and other scientists.


Responsibilities:

  • Ensure the accuracy, consistency, and scientific validity of toxicological data captured by large language models (LLMs)
  • Cross-check data outputs against original sources, evaluate the reliability of AI-derived information, and contribute to the development of high-quality datasets to support drug safety and development efforts
  • Review toxicological data output generated by LLMs and validate against original resources
  • Identify and document discrepancies, errors, or ambiguities in AI-derived data
  • Ensure consistency, completeness, and scientific accuracy of curated toxicological datasets
  • Apply toxicological knowledge to evaluate data related to preclinical and clinical toxicities, mechanisms of toxicity, safety biomarkers, and risk assessments
  • Provide feedback to enhance LLM performance based on identified gaps or inaccuracies in the extracted data



Requirements:

  • Masterâ€™s in Biology, Pharmacology, Toxicology, Drug Development, Biotechnology
  • Experience as Toxicological Data Curator with a background in Biology, Toxicology, Drug Development, or Veterinary Medicine
  • Experience with data curation, annotation, or systematic review methodologies
  • Understanding of machine learning, LLMs, or natural language processing (NLP) tools
  • Experienced in synthesizing complex toxicological data and in presenting conclusions


If you want to learn more about this opportunity, please feel free to reach out directly to abeassalazar@actalentservices.com


*Please note that we can only consider EU/Schengen applications, or valid Swiss permit

4151461141,https://ch.linkedin.com/jobs/view/product-data-analyst-temporary-contract-at-lastminute-com-4151461141?position=21&pageNum=0&refId=ShjfMc%2B3nS1gmB3iVXNzOg%3D%3D&trackingId=aAMFlUyocr6iiLGhjrOLrQ%3D%3D,Product Data Analyst (Temporary Contract),lastminute.com,"Chiasso, Ticino, Switzerland","At lastminute.com, we live for the holidays. We are the European Travel-Tech leader in Dynamic Holiday Packages. With technology, we turn spontaneous thoughts into meaningful experiences, helping people travel the world.

We are looking for a Product Data Analyst to join our team of around 1,700 people worldwide to help us power up the traveler's journey for millions of holidaymakers. If you are passionate about solving complex problems and skilled at analyzing big data sets, keep on reading, as you might be the perfect fit for this job.

The candidate will have the opportunity to become a key member of the team leveraging the analytical skills to produce actionable insights and improve customer experience. Specifically, the analyst will have the chance to optimise post-sales processes and work on cross domain projects (Login,APP, CRM & Marketing, Consents, etc.).
Team - you will join the Data Analytics team within the Technology department.
Travel time required - A couple of Business Trips per year to meet the team
Data extraction, analysis and reporting, in order to drive performance insights and support business decisions
Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns to optimise business performance
Works closely with internal stakeholders in order to identify and prioritise business needs and opportunities
Explores and proactively propose new product and business opportunities
Communicates and presents results, insights and recommendations to all levels of the company, clearly and concisely
Cooperate with other Data Analysts across the company on joint projects, to identify and exploit synergies and to preserve/improve governance on data and on business knowledge
Closely partner with Data Engineers to identify data needs and support the data quality of the deliverables
- At least 4 years of experience in a similar role
- Strong knowledge of SQL and Excel.
- Good knowledge of data visualization tools like Qlik, Tableau, Looker, Power BI.
- Ability to influence decision makers through presentations of analysis
- Familiarity with digital and ecommerce business
- Previous experience in the travel industry
- Experience in building pipelines and data models
- An inclusive, friendly, and international environment (youâ€™ll be working with colleagues from +10 countries and over 48 nationalities)
- Shorter working week (36h as full time), with a half working day on Fridays
- Flexible start and end of the working day
- Possibility to work from anywhere for a period of time per year defined according to local regulations
- Fri-Yays: half a day on Friday morning with a no-meeting mandate and dedicated to deep work, personal growth, learning and training and/or focus time.

- Professional and managerial skills development training paths, access to e-learning platforms such as Oâ€™reilly, Udemy, Coursera (depending on the department), and to our internal platform offering bespoke training content.
- 2 paid days off per year for volunteering purposes
- Occasional social events to foster connections among colleagues
- Travel industry discounts and flash exclusive staff fares
- We support our employees through life's significant moments with leave options (e.g. parental responsibilities, marriages, bereavements, relocations, etc.)
Wish you were here? We do, too!
(*Please note the process can slightly vary. The recruiter in charge will share more details when setting up the interview)
Our commitment to celebrate diversity and generate belonging

At the heart of our culture is a commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, sexual orientation, religion, gender identity or expression, and accessibility. We value different lived experiences and respect viewpoints, as we know unicity drives innovation. We want to make sure our people reflect the communities across the world we help travel.

At lastminute.com, we live for the holidays. We are the European Travel-Tech leader in Dynamic Holiday Packages. With technology, we turn spontaneous thoughts into meaningful experiences, helping people travel the world.



Job Description

We are looking for a Product Data Analyst to join our team of around 1,700 people worldwide to help us power up the traveler's journey for millions of holidaymakers. If you are passionate about solving complex problems and skilled at analyzing big data sets, keep on reading, as you might be the perfect fit for this job.

The candidate will have the opportunity to become a key member of the team leveraging the analytical skills to produce actionable insights and improve customer experience. Specifically, the analyst will have the chance to optimise post-sales processes and work on cross domain projects (Login,APP, CRM &
column2:
Marketing, Consents, etc.).

The job in brief:

Job Title - Product Data Analyst

Working model - Chiasso hybrid

Team - you will join the Data Analytics team within the Technology department.

Location - Chiasso

Travel time required - A couple of Business Trips per year to meet the team

What your impact will be

  • Data extraction, analysis and reporting, in order to drive performance insights and support business decisions
  • Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns to optimise business performance
  • Works closely with internal stakeholders in order to identify and prioritise business needs and opportunities
  • Explores and proactively propose new product and business opportunities
  • Communicates and presents results, insights and recommendations to all levels of the company, clearly and concisely
  • Cooperate with other Data Analysts across the company on joint projects, to identify and exploit synergies and to preserve/improve governance on data and on business knowledge

Qualifications

Your expertise:

- At least 4 years of experience in a similar role

- Strong knowledge of SQL and Excel.

- Good knowledge of data visualization tools like Qlik, Tableau, Looker, Power BI.

- Proficiency in English.

Desirable:

- Python

Additional Information

- Professional and managerial skills development training paths, access to e-learning platforms such as Oâ€™reilly, Udemy, Coursera (depending on the department), and to our internal platform offering bespoke training content.

Other perks:
- 2 paid days off per year for volunteering purposes

- Occasional social events to foster connections among colleagues

- Travel industry discounts and flash exclusive staff fares

- We support our employees through life's significant moments with leave options (e.g. parental responsibilities, marriages, bereavements, relocations, etc.)

Wish you were here? We do, too!

- HR interview

- Offline Tech test

- 1st interview (Manager): Test review

- 2nd interview (Manager + team member):

- Offer extended

At the heart of our culture is a commitment to inclusion across race, gender, age, sexual orientation, religion, gender identity or expression, and accessibility. We strongly believe in an equal opportunity space, which is welcoming and celebrates the uniqueness of everyone who works here. We value different lived experiences and respect viewpoints, as we know unicity drives innovation. We want to make sure our people reflect the communities across the world we help travel.

column1: Strong skills in statistical modelling, derivatives pricing, or volatility analysis.
Exposure to algorithmic trading and options markets is an asset.

On behalf of our client, Swisslinx is seeking a Quantitative Researcher. In this role, youâ€™ll develop and implement algorithmic trading strategies while building the infrastructure to support large-scale quantitative research.


Key Responsibilities:


  • Build and maintain data pipelines for processing and executing low-latency trades in spot, futures, and options markets.
  • Optimize trading strategies with efficient order placement and alpha signals to minimize slippage.
  • Develop tools for performance analysis and risk management with portfolio and risk teams.
  • Evaluate strategies through post-trade analysis and recommend improvements.
  • Test and refine trading engines with internal data to ensure stability.
  • Support OTC and market-making desks with liquidity assessments.
  • Conduct code reviews and ensure best practices in development.
  • Document systems and processes for internal use.
  • Collaborate with researchers and developers to integrate research into live trading.


Job Requirements:


  • PhD in quantitative finance, computer science, mathematics, or related field.
  • Experience in high-frequency trading and market making is a must.
  • Proficient in Python
column2:
Rust or C# knowledge.
  • Strong skills in statistical modelling, derivatives pricing, or volatility analysis.
  • Exposure to algorithmic trading and options markets is an asset.
  • Fluency in English required.

I seek a senior quantitative researcher with experience researching, modelling, developing, and implementing sophisticated alphas, specialising in systematic equities and/or statistical arbitrage. Global search - visa and relocation to Switzerland if not already resident.
Major global hedge fund ($40+bn, 30-year track record, stellar reputation and world-class team and management) - multi-strat platform.

New team and the first hire for a senior Quant Portfolio Manager with 15 years of successful track record managing over $1bn and $100+mn annual PNL record. No infrastructure build-out, pure alpha research and implementation.

We don't care about the number of years of experience. We care about your alpha research process. We care about the successful trading signals you have developed. We care about your knowledge of the inner mechanics of the trading strategies you work on and are live in the market. We care about the Python code that you write and your implementation process. We care about your strategy performance statistics. We care that you have been trained and appropriately mentored at a Tier One hedge fund, prop trading firm, or investment bank.

anything Crypto, short job tenures, new graduates, risk analysts/managers, portfolio managers, data analysts/scientists, machine learning/AI engineers, fundamental strategies, fixed income, fx, commodities, derivatives pricing.

In this internship, you will contribute to enhancing analytics processes and data workflows to support aviation risk management, including safety, security, and compliance.

Support risk-related decision-making at SWISS by applying your data engineering and analytics skills. You will enhance analytics pipelines, implement data workflows, and support the development of our cloud-based analytics and process automation infrastructure.
Design and implement data pipelines for preparation, deployment, evaluation, and monitoring using Azure Data Factory and Databricks.
Work with diverse data formats, including SQL tables, JSON files, and other noSQL formats.
Apply programming expertise to streamline and automate processes.
Improve and optimize cloud analytics processes.
Contribute to the research and development of safety and risk management concepts using data analytics.
Flexible workhours and part-time working models
Masterâ€™s student or graduate with focus on analytics (computer science, mathematics, data science, etcâ€¦)
Programming experience with proficiency in at least one language (e.g.â€¯SQL, Python, R, â€¦)
Familiarity with cloud environments (e.g. MS Azure) is an advantage
Strong technical aptitude and enthusiasm for learning new tools and processes.
Very good spoken and written English skills
For any further questions, please contact our Recruiting Services Center at +41 44 564 22 66.

column2:
Analytics Team leads the analytics and digitalization initiatives integral to the Protection Management framework of SWISS. In this internship, you will contribute to enhancing analytics processes and data workflows to support aviation risk management, including safety, security, and compliance.

Starting date: May 01, 2025

Tasks

Support risk-related decision-making at SWISS by applying your data engineering and analytics skills. You will enhance analytics pipelines, implement data workflows, and support the development of our cloud-based analytics and process automation infrastructure.

  • Design and implement data pipelines for preparation, deployment, evaluation, and monitoring using Azure Data Factory and Databricks.
  • Work with diverse data formats, including SQL tables, JSON files, and other noSQL formats.
  • Apply programming expertise to streamline and automate processes.
  • Improve and optimize cloud analytics processes.
  • Contribute to the research and development of safety and risk management concepts using data analytics.

Benefits

  • Remote working (e.g. from home)
  • Employee and networking events
  • Subsidized parking or public transport
  • Flexible workhours and part-time working models
  • Discounts
  • Diversity programmes
  • Flight benefits
  • Company health management
  • 25 days of annual vacation

Requirements

  • Masterâ€™s student or graduate with focus on analytics (computer science, mathematics, data science, etcâ€¦)
  • Programming experience with proficiency in at least one language (e.g.â€¯SQL, Python, R, â€¦)
  • Familiarity with cloud environments (e.g. MS Azure) is an advantage
  • Strong technical aptitude and enthusiasm for learning new tools and processes.
  • Self-motivated, reliable, and adaptable.
  • Very good spoken and written English skills

For any further questions, please contact our Recruiting Services Center at +41 44 564 22 66.

Contact

Chrysanthi Tsimitri

recruiting.services@swiss.com

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

Immunai is an engineering-first platform company aiming to improve therapeutic decision-making throughout the drug discovery and development process. We are mapping the immune system at unprecedented scale and granularity and applying machine learning to this massive clinico-immune database, in order to generate novel insights into disease pathology for our partners - pharma companies and research institutes. We provide a comprehensive, end-to-end solution - from data generation and curation to therapeutics development, that continuously supports and validates the capabilities of our platform.
As drug development is becoming increasingly inefficient, our ultimate goal is to help bring breakthrough medicines to patients as quickly and successfully as possible.
Immunai is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

The Metadata Developers Team, part of the Immunai Software group, focuses on advanced tools and solutions to retrieve, store, handle, and analyze complex descriptive biological data, such as laboratory and clinical metadata, with extensive use of domain ontologies. In close collaboration with Immunaiâ€™s biocurators and biology experts, we are continuously advancing our technology and data models to improve the consistency and descriptive power of our vast clinical database, as well as the usability and accessibility of data that feed the companyâ€™s most advanced algorithms for therapeutic decision-making and discovery.

As Senior Data Engineer at Immunai, you will master metadata-centric software solutions for biological and clinical knowledge by developing a deep understanding of the bio-curation activity and the related data models and processes. You will translate complex operational and data requirements into modular and efficient tools that aim at seamlessly integrating the various phases of curation. You will also be an interface between data producers and consumers to ensure that maximum value can be extracted from our data assets. While being a major code contributor to new and existing tools, you will also act as a guide and mentor to foster innovation and high-quality coding style across the team. Finally, you will be the liaison with other key figures, such as data architect, data steward, and tech leads from complementary domains, in order to ensure alignment on software development standards, data architecture, and data operational processes.
Location: ZÃ¼rich, Switzerland. This position requires working in a hybrid model from Immunai offices in ZÃ¼rich.

Guide and collaborate with other Metadata Dev team members in an agile setting to build and maintain new metadata pipelines and applications, or to enhance existing ones, while promoting consistency and harmonization of different components

Interact with biologists, bioinformaticians, and other cross-functional teams to understand and formalize their data needs and tooling requirements, articulate fit-for-purpose solutions that are also innovative and forward-looking

Take responsibility for the quality and integrity of deliverables - you will overlook the coding practices of the team and make sure that they align with the standards set for the whole Software Development group
Participate and contribute in regular meetings to align on technical and operational decisions with your peers from other teams or other stakeholders
Coordinate and contribute to the documentation, training, and user support efforts
Bachelorâ€™s or Masterâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Software Engineering, Bioinformatics, or a related field

5+ years of experience as a Data Engineer, with a strong track-record in handling complex datasets, mastering elaborated data processes, and translating challenging product requirements into effective software solutions
Excellent programming skills with Python (must have) and preferably with another modern high-level language
Extensive experience with relational databases (PostgreSQL preferred), including query optimization and good general understanding of database architectures
Familiarity with other data storage technologies (e.g. HDFS, NoSQL databases) and data warehousing platforms (ideally, BigQuery)
Knowledge of common data operations and integration concepts (e.g. ETL, ELT), with proven ability to design efficient solutions and implement the best practices
Basic understanding of modern web development technologies and architectures
An analytical mindset with strong problem-solving skills and abstraction power
Excellent English communication skills, both written and spoken
Solid understanding of web development and architecture, preferably with front-end coding experience on the JS TypeScript + React framework
Previous experience with major cloud environments is a strong advantage (Google Cloud Platform preferred)
Coding experience in large Java EE projects is a strong advantage
Some experience with orchestration tools is desirable (e.g. Apache Airflow, Dagster)
Knowledge of secure coding practices, authentication protocols (OAuth, JWT), and data privacy standards is a plus
Familiarity with biotech or healthcare data is also an advantage
You want to make an impact on humankind
You enjoy getting things done and striving for excellence
You collaborate effectively with people of diverse backgrounds and cultures
You are candid, authentic, and transparent

*Please note that when you apply for a position at Immunai, your application will be processed via our recruitment platform Comeet. You can read more about how we process personal data here: https://www.immunai.com/privacy-policy/

About Immunai:

Immunai is an engineering-first platform company aiming to improve therapeutic decision-making throughout the drug discovery and development process. We are mapping the immune system at unprecedented scale and granularity and applying machine learning to this massive clinico-immune database, in order to generate novel insights into disease pathology for our partners - pharma companies and research institutes. We provide a comprehensive, end-to-end solution - from data generation and curation to therapeutics development, that continuously supports and validates the capabilities of our platform.

As drug development is becoming increasingly inefficient, our ultimate goal is to help bring breakthrough medicines to patients as quickly and successfully as possible.

Immunai is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.


About the role:

The Metadata Developers Team, part of the Immunai Software group, focuses on advanced tools and solutions to retrieve, store, handle, and analyze complex descriptive biological data, such as laboratory and clinical metadata, with extensive use of domain ontologies. In close collaboration with Immunaiâ€™s biocurators and biology experts, we are continuously advancing our technology and data models to improve the consistency and descriptive power of our vast clinical database, as well as the usability and accessibility of data that feed the companyâ€™s most advanced algorithms for therapeutic decision-making and discovery.

As Senior Data Engineer at Immunai, you will master metadata-centric software solutions for biological and clinical knowledge by developing a deep understanding of the bio-curation activity and the related data models and processes. You will translate complex operational and data requirements into modular and efficient tools that aim at seamlessly integrating the various phases of curation. You will also be an interface between data producers and consumers to ensure that maximum value can be extracted from our data assets. While being a major code contributor to new and existing tools, you will also act as a guide and mentor to foster innovation and high-quality coding style across the team. Finally, you will be the liaison with other key figures, such as data architect, data steward, and tech leads from complementary domains, in order to ensure alignment on software development standards, data architecture, and data operational processes.

Location: ZÃ¼rich, Switzerland. This position requires working in a hybrid model from Immunai offices in ZÃ¼rich.


What will you do?

  • Guide and collaborate with other Metadata Dev team members in an agile setting to build and maintain new metadata pipelines and applications, or to enhance existing ones, while promoting consistency and harmonization of different components
  • Interact with biologists, bioinformaticians, and other cross-functional teams to understand and formalize their data needs and tooling requirements, articulate fit-for-purpose solutions that are also innovative and forward-looking
  • Take responsibility for the quality and integrity of deliverables - you will overlook the coding practices of the team and make sure that they align with the standards set for the whole Software Development group
  • Participate and contribute in regular meetings to align on technical and operational decisions with your peers from other teams or other stakeholders
  • Coordinate and contribute to the documentation, training, and user support efforts


Required qualifications:

  • Bachelorâ€™s or Masterâ€™s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Software Engineering, Bioinformatics, or a related field
  • 5+ years of experience as a Data Engineer, with a strong track-record in handling complex datasets, mastering elaborated data processes, and translating challenging product requirements into effective software solutions
  • Excellent programming skills with Python (must have) and preferably with another modern high-level language
  • Extensive experience with relational databases (PostgreSQL preferred), including query optimization and good general understanding of database architectures
  • Familiarity with other data storage technologies (e.g. HDFS, NoSQL databases) and data warehousing platforms (ideally, BigQuery)
  • Knowledge of common data operations and integration concepts (e.g. ETL, ELT), with proven ability to design efficient solutions and implement the best practices
  • Basic understanding of modern web development technologies and architectures
  • An analytical mindset with strong problem-solving skills and abstraction power
  • Excellent English communication skills, both written and spoken

Preferred qualifications:

  • Solid understanding of web development and architecture, preferably with front-end coding experience on the JS TypeScript + React framework
  • Previous experience with major cloud environments is a strong advantage (Google Cloud Platform preferred)
  • Coding experience in large Java EE projects is a strong advantage
  • Some experience with orchestration tools is desirable (e.g. Apache Airflow, Dagster)
  • Knowledge of secure coding practices, authentication protocols (OAuth, JWT), and data privacy standards is a plus
  • Familiarity with biotech or healthcare data is also an advantage

Desired personal traits:

  • You want to make an impact on humankind
  • You prioritize â€œWeâ€ over â€œIâ€
  • You enjoy getting things done and striving for excellence
  • You collaborate effectively with people of diverse backgrounds and cultures
  • You have a growth mindset
  • You are candid, authentic, and transparent


*Please note that when you apply for a position at Immunai, your application will be processed via our recruitment platform Comeet. You can read more about how we process personal data here: https://www.immunai.com/privacy-policy/
